title: Account Officer Job at Darlington Hall
content:
The Darlington Hall was established in 2009 as one arm of The Events Warehouse Limited to provide an event centre of high standard, with excellent support services required to successfully host various Corporate, Social and other Special events. At The Darlington Hall, our clients are assured a satisfactory event in a serene and secure environment. Darlington Hall is easily accessible from all parts of the Lagos metropolis.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer
Job Location: Ilupeju, Lagos (Head office)
Employment Type: Full-time
Report to: Head, Accountant
Industry: The Events Warehouse
Department: Finanace

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As an Account Officer at the Events Ware House, you will play a key role in the finance and accounting functions of the company.
	You will be maintaining financial records, processing transactions, preparing reports, and providing general administrative support.
	This position requires attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and a basic understanding of accounting principles.


Responsibilities
Support to Finance Team:


	Assist in budget preparation and monitoring.
	Collaborate with other departments to gather financial data and information.
	Provide general administrative support to the finance department.


Communication and Coordination:


	Communicate effectively with vendors, clients, and internal stakeholders regarding financial matters.
	Liaise with the procurement team to ensure accurate recording of purchases and payments.
	Support the finance team in resolving any discrepancies or issues.


Financial Transactions:


	Process accounts payable and receivable transactions accurately and in a timely manner.
	Prepare and issue invoices, receipts, and bank deposits.
	Reconcile financial statements and reports to ensure accuracy.
	Monitor and follow up on outstanding payments to ensure timely collection.
	Maintain petty cash records and reconcile petty cash transactions.


Record Keeping and Data Entry:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records in the accounting system.
	Enter financial data into the accounting software with a high level of accuracy.
	Organize and maintain filing systems for invoices, receipts, and other financial documents.
	Assist in preparing financial reports and statements as needed.


Compliance and Audit Support:


	Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and accounting standards.
	Assist in preparing documents and records for internal and external audits.
	Help implement and maintain internal controls to safeguard company assets.


KPI


	Accuracy of Financial records: percentage of reconciliation completed with no discrepancies, and number of errors in financial reports, aiming for zero errors.
	Compliance and Audit Preparedness: completion of all audit preparation tasks by set deadline and number of audit findings related to financial record-keeping, aiming for zero findings.
	Efficiency in data entry: Average time taken to enter financial data into accounting system, and number of data entry errors, aiming for minimal errors per month.
	Communication Effectiveness: Feedback from finance team members on clarity and completeness of communication, and number of vendor/client disputes resolved, aiming for high resolution rate.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	2 -3 years of experience as an account officer.
	Knowledge of basic accounting principles and practices.
	Proficient in MS Office, especially Excel, and accounting software
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry.
	Excellent organizational and time-management skills.
	Good communication and Interpersonal abilities
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Prior experience in a rental or equipment leasing company is a plus.

title: Inventory Officer Job at Agric & Culture Company
content:
The Agric & Culture Company is a fast growing Food Condiments Manufacturing Company specializing in high-quality mayonnaise and seasoning products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer
Job Locations: Jakande & Isolo - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary 
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As we expand our footprint across new markets, we’re looking to fill the position of an inventory officer to help improve how to track and manage raw materials, packaging items and finished goods. 
	This person will work closely with production, warehouse and procurement to ensure that stock is well recorded, organized and accurate at all times.


Responsibilities 


	Monitor and manage stock levels to prevent overstocking or stock outs
	Keep daily records of stock in and out
	Conduct regular stock counts and reconcile physical stock with records
	Help ensure proper labelling and storage of items.
	Generate daily, weekly, and monthly inventory reports


Requirements & Qualifications


	Minimum of OND / HND / BSc in Accounting, Business Administration, Economics or any related field
	1–2 years of experience in inventory or warehouse management (preferred)
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or inventory software
	Strong numerical and record-keeping skills
	Ability to work under pressure and with minimal supervision
	Attention to detail and good organizational skills
	Physical stamina to lift or move inventory items (if required).


Benefits


	Competitive Salary: N200,000 Monthly.
	HMO
	Opportunities for growth and development


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and Cover Letter to: recruitment@agricandculture.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: If you’re organized, reliable, and ready to help us keep our inventory under control - we want to hear from you!

title: Account Officer Job at Rainoil Logistics Services Limited
content:
Rainoil Logistics, a subsidiary of Rainoil Group, is an integrated downstream oil and gas company. A prominent player in the Nigerian industry, the company’s operations span across the downstream value chain i.e. Petroleum Product Storage, Haulage / Distribution and Retail Sales

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer
Job Location: Ijegun-Egba - Satellite town, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a young Chartered Accountant with appreciable experience in Account Payable, Finance Analytics and Data Analytics, to work with our team. 
	The ideal candidate should possess 2-3 years in-depth knowledge of accounting practices and principles


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare and review Bank Reconciliation Statements to ensure accuracy and resolve discrepancies.
	Manage journal entries and postings to maintain accurate financial records
	Monitor and analyse accounts receivable and payable balances to optimize cash flow and minimize risks
	Conduct intercompany reconciliations to ensure consistency and accuracy across accounts
	Contribute to the preparation of management reports, providing valuable insights to support businessdecisions


Educational Qualification and Experience


	First Degree (First class or Second-Class Upper Division) in accounting from any recognized University in Nigeria or outside Nigeria.
	Must be an Associate Member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria (ICAN).
	Must posses the NYSC discharge certificate.


Required Skills:


	Accounting Software: Proven expertise in utilizing accounting software and packages to manage financial transactions and reports
	Accounting Practices and Principles: Knowledge of sound accounting practices and principles
	Tax Laws and Regulations: Appreciable knowledge of tax laws and regulations
	ERP Systems: In-depth knowledge and understanding of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems to streamline business operations and financial management
	Microsoft Office: Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite particularly MS Word, MS Excel, Power Point Presentation
	Financial Statement: Skills in data analysis, financial statement and preparation
	Attention to details, analytical thinking and good time management.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Opportunities for professional growth and development.
	A supportive and dynamic work environment.
	Other benefits such as HMO and Pension benefit etc


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrlogistics@rainoil.com using “Account Officer, Lagos State” as the subject of the mail.
